 chest_pain_type = "no chest pain",  have_dyspnoea = "no",  have_family_history = "no",  have_smoking_history = "no",  have_dyslipidemia = "no",  have_hypertension = "no",  have_diabetes = "no",  output = "grouping" ) [1] "very low" patient_data <- tibble::tribble(     ~unique_id,     ~age,     ~sex,      ~chest_pain_type, ~have_dyspnoea,      ~have_family_history, ~have_smoking_history, ~have_dyslipidemia, ~have_hypertension, ~have_diabetes,     "45 year old male with typical chest pain, no dyspnoea, hypertension and diabetes",     45, "male",      "typical", "no",       "no", "no", "no", "yes", "yes",     "70 year old female with no chest pain, dyspnoea, have smoking history (past or current smoker) and dyslipidemia",     70, "female",      "no chest pain", "yes",       "no", "yes", "yes", "no", "no" )  risk_data <- patient_data |>     dplyr::mutate(       esc_2024_ptp_group = purrr::pmap_chr(         .l = list(           age = .data[["age"]],           sex = .data[["sex"]],           chest_pain_type = .data[["chest_pain_type"]],           have_dyspnoea = .data[["have_dyspnoea"]],           have_family_history = .data[["have_family_history"]],           have_smoking_history = .data[["have_smoking_history"]],            have_dyslipidemia = .data[["have_dyslipidemia"]],            have_hypertension = .data[["have_hypertension"]],            have_diabetes = .data[["have_diabetes"]],           output = "grouping"         ),         .f = pretestcad::calculate_esc_2024_fig_4_ptp,       ),       esc_2024_ptp_numeric = purrr::pmap_int(         .l = list(           age = .data[["age"]],           sex = .data[["sex"]],           chest_pain_type = .data[["chest_pain_type"]],           have_dyspnoea = .data[["have_dyspnoea"]],           have_family_history = .data[["have_family_history"]],           have_smoking_history = .data[["have_smoking_history"]],           have_dyslipidemia = .data[["have_dyslipidemia"]],           have_hypertension = .data[["have_hypertension"]],           have_diabetes = .data[["have_diabetes"]],           output = "numeric"         ),         .f = pretestcad::calculate_esc_2024_fig_4_ptp       ),       esc_2024_ptp_percent = purrr::pmap_chr(         .l = list(           age = .data[["age"]],           sex = .data[["sex"]],           chest_pain_type = .data[["chest_pain_type"]],           have_dyspnoea = .data[["have_dyspnoea"]],           have_family_history = .data[["have_family_history"]],           have_smoking_history = .data[["have_smoking_history"]],           have_dyslipidemia = .data[["have_dyslipidemia"]],           have_hypertension = .data[["have_hypertension"]],           have_diabetes = .data[["have_diabetes"]],           output = "percentage"         ),         .f = pretestcad::calculate_esc_2024_fig_4_ptp       )     ) |>     dplyr::select(       c("unique_id", "esc_2024_ptp_group",          "esc_2024_ptp_numeric", "esc_2024_ptp_percent")    )  print(risk_data) what: Calculate ACCF/AHA/ACP/AATS/PCNA/SCAI/STS 2012 PTP for obstructive CAD — calculate_aha_2012_tbl_9_ptp
title: Calculate ACCF/AHA/ACP/AATS/PCNA/SCAI/STS 2012 PTP for obstructive CAD — calculate_aha_2012_tbl_9_ptp
text: function returns patient's pre-test Probability (PTP) obstructive coronary artery disease (CAD) based American College Cardiology Foundation, American Heart Association, American College Physicians, American Association Thoracic Surgery, Preventive Cardiovascular Nurses Association, Society Cardiovascular Angiography Interventions, Society Thoracic Surgeons 2012 guidelines.

title: Calculate ACCF/AHA/ACP/AATS/PCNA/SCAI/STS 2012 PTP for obstructive CAD — calculate_aha_2012_tbl_9_ptp
code: calculate_aha_2012_tbl_9_ptp(   age,   sex,   chest_pain_type,   output = c("numeric", "percentage") )

title: Calculate ACCF/AHA/ACP/AATS/PCNA/SCAI/STS 2012 PTP for obstructive CAD — calculate_aha_2012_tbl_9_ptp
text: age Input integer value indicate age patient. sex Input characters (female, male) indicate sex patient. female male chest_pain_type Input characters (typical, atypical, nonanginal) indicate chest pain characteristics patient. typical stands patient typical chest pain. atypical stands patient atypical chest pain. nonanginal stands patient nonanginal non-specific chest pain. output Input text indicate pre-test probability results expressed Default: c("numeric", "percentage") numeric means PTP expressed integer probability (0-100). percentage means PTP expressed percentage text (0-100%).

title: Calculate ACCF/AHA/ACP/AATS/PCNA/SCAI/STS 2012 PTP for obstructive CAD — calculate_aha_2012_tbl_9_ptp
text: integer percentage representing patient's PTP obstructive CAD based ACCF/AHA/ACP/AATS/PCNA/SCAI/STS 2012 guidelines.

title: Calculate ACCF/AHA/ACP/AATS/PCNA/SCAI/STS 2012 PTP for obstructive CAD — calculate_aha_2012_tbl_9_ptp
text: predictive model used create guidelines based patients Diamond Forrester Coronary Artery Surgery Study.

title: Calculate ACCF/AHA/ACP/AATS/PCNA/SCAI/STS 2012 PTP for obstructive CAD — calculate_aha_2012_tbl_9_ptp
code: # 35 year old female with typical chest pain calculate_aha_2012_tbl_9_ptp(     age = 35,     sex = "female",     chest_pain_type = "typical",     output = "percentage" ) #> [1] "26%"  # 65 year old male with nonanginal chest pain calculate_aha_2012_tbl_9_ptp(     age = 65,     sex = "male",     chest_pain_type = "nonanginal",     output = "percentage" ) #> [1] "27%"

what: Calculate AHA/ACC 2021 PTP for obstructive CAD — calculate_aha_2021_ptp
title: Calculate AHA/ACC 2021 PTP for obstructive CAD — calculate_aha_2021_ptp
text: function returns patient's pre-test Probability (PTP) obstructive coronary artery disease (CAD) based American Heart Association/American College Cardiology (AHA/ACC) 2021 guidelines.

title: Calculate AHA/ACC 2021 PTP for obstructive CAD — calculate_aha_2021_ptp
code: calculate_aha_2021_ptp(   age,   sex,   have_dyspnoea,   have_chest_pain,   output = c("grouping", "numeric", "percentage") )

title: Calculate AHA/ACC 2021 PTP for obstructive CAD — calculate_aha_2021_ptp
text: age Input integer value indicate age patient. sex Input characters (female, male) indicate sex patient. female male have_dyspnoea Input characters (, yes) indicate patient dyspnoea symptoms. stands dyspnoea symptoms. yes stands dyspnoea symptoms. have_chest_pain Input characters (, yes) indicate patient chest pain. stands dyspnoea symptoms. yes stands dyspnoea symptoms. output Input text indicate pre-test probability results expressed Default: c("grouping", "numeric", "percentage") grouping means PTP expressed Low, Intermediate High. low PTP less 5%. low PTP 5% 15%. intermediate PTP 15% 50%. high PTP 50%. numeric means PTP expressed integer probability (0-100). percentage means PTP expressed percentage text (0-100%).

title: Calculate AHA/ACC 2021 PTP for obstructive CAD — calculate_aha_2021_ptp
text: integer, percentage category representing patient's PTP obstructive CAD based AHA/ACC 2021 guidelines. See parameter option output information.

title: Calculate AHA/ACC 2021 PTP for obstructive CAD — calculate_aha_2021_ptp
text: predictive model used create guidelines based patients European countries low cardiovascular disease (CVD) risk. patient dyspnoea particular chest pain type (typical, atypical, nonanginal), chest pain type take precedence dyspnoea

title: Calculate AHA/ACC 2021 PTP for obstructive CAD — calculate_aha_2021_ptp
code: # 35 year old female with chest pain calculate_aha_2021_ptp(     age = 35,     sex = "female",     have_dyspnoea = "no",     have_chest_pain = "yes",     output = "percentage" ) #> [1] "<=5%"  # 75 year old male with only dyspnoea calculate_aha_2021_ptp(     age = 75,     sex = "male",     have_dyspnoea = "yes",     have_chest_pain = "no",     output = "percentage" ) #> [1] "32%"

Blacks, Asians, etc. have_diabetes Input characters (, yes) indicate patient diabetes. stands diabetes. yes stands diabetes. have_hypertension Input characters (, yes) indicate patient hypertension. stands hypertension. yes stands hypertension. have_dyslipidemia Input characters (, yes) indicate patient dyslipidemia. stands dyslipidemia. yes stands dyslipidemia. have_smoking_history Input characters (, yes) indicate patient smoking history (current past smoker). stands smoking history (non-smoker). yes stands smoking history (current past smoker). have_family_history Input characters (, yes) indicate patient family history CAD. stands family history CAD. yes stands family history CAD. have_stress_symptoms Input characters (, yes) indicate patient symptoms related physical mental stress. can set NA patient results inconclusive taken stress test exercise treadmill testing, stress echocardiography, stress nuclear imaging. stands symptoms (negative results) related physical mental stress. yes stands symptoms (positive results) related physical mental stress. NA stands inconclusive results patient taken stress test Default: NA
